Reviews.Content: No Problems in this hotel To anyone visiting Italy for the first time please remeber it's NOT the United States. What you get for 4 star there is not the same standard your going to get in Europe. This hotel was very clean. Our room was cleaned everyday. The linens and bathroom were always very clean. The room and bathroom was a little small if you are going to compare it to what you get in the US. at the same star rating. It was fine for two of us. The breakfast was excellent everyday. Fresh eggs, several kinds of breads and sweets rolls. Juice coffee, toast, ceral, cheese and ham. It was a little crowded a few mornings if we got there between 9-10 but we always found a table. By the way, as one person said there is only one english speaking channel on the TV which is CNN. But it's not the US so don't expect TV channels in a language other then their own. I was glad to have that.We would have no problem staying there again.
Reviews.Author: SSC57

Reviews.Content: Totally disliked everything about this hotel! My partner and I visited Florence between 23rd to the 29th of August 2008 and was booked into the Diplomat Hotel. The only thing that was good about this hotel was the location - it was just next to the main train station in Florence, the Santa Maria Novella station.I regretted not reading through the reviews of this hotel before choosing to stay at this hotel. Some of the problems that we encountered during our whole stay are as below :1. Reception was very unfriendly2. The bathroom of the room we stayed in (112) was of open plan and wasn't practical at all. Everytime we took a shower, the  entire floor of the bathroom was very slippery.3. We got a call around 9pm on the third night from reception. I answered the phone and all she said was she was waiting for us. And when I asked what it was for, she said that there were problems with the bathroom and that we had to change rooms. All this at 9pm at night, with no one giving us prior notice. Though we may have not been in during the day, the management should have left us a note about it. The  reception also said that if we chose to continue staying in the room, we could, as long as we didn't use the bathroom. Now  tell me, how could anyone cope without using the bathroom? That was really ridiculous and upset us.4. During breakfast one day, we were allocated a table. We got  our juices to the table and continued to the breakfast bar to get some cereal. Upon our return, there was another couple sat at our table and we both looked at the manager. He then moved us to another table without even apologizing.5. On our departure, I asked the reception where we could get a shuttle bus to the airport and he replied very rudely, not giving proper instructions. We finally found our way and bought tickets from the bus station. I then asked the guy at the counter where we should wait and boy was he extremely rude! I asked him politely again and he just pointed with a look of disinterest on his face.Our problems didn't end there. Whilst we were waiting for the busto the airport together with a Spanish couple, the bus finally arrived, but only took 1 passenger on-board and just left us, all looking confused and in total frustration!The four of us finally did manage to make our way to the airport, but boy, what an experience! If I ever did go back to Florence, I would never book myself into this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: sheradelia

Reviews.Content: Convenient but other only OK This hotel is perfect for visiting the highlights and is very near the train.. As for the hotel itself it was too hot, the rooms were a little small but good for the price and time of year, the bathrooms good. The staff were not very helpful and don't seem to smile at all.I thought the food was poor
Reviews.Author: Tippguy

Reviews.Content: Not very good at customer service!!!! We had requested a superior twin room, but were sent to a tiny double room on the fifth floor next to the breakfast room. We asked to be moved and were dismayed at the treatment we received by the reception staff. We were eventually moved to a twin room in the other part of the hotel. Although Florence is beautiful the staff at this hotel were so rude and unhelpful it was quite offputting.The hotel bar doubles as a breakfast room and had no atmosphere, it didn't even have the wine we requested which was only pinot grigio!A cleaner started hoovering outside of our room at 8.15am on the saturday morning, which is not a great way to be woken up.
Reviews.Author: florencevisit

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel!! Cant recommend it enough! We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last week. The hotel was absolutely lovely, wonderful location for exploring the city, the room was spotlessly clean and beautiful. The staff could not have been more helpful - I hurt my ankle and they were so, so helpful and very concerned.The breakfast was a great buffet selection - kept us going for the whole day.I would definitely stay at the Diplomat again, and have already recommended it to all my friends.
Reviews.Author: AimiRH

Reviews.Content: Many Problems Given room withsmoke smell. Moved to a second room where there was crack under stool so flooded bathroom. Man came up and said to move to new room but offered no assistance in helping to move, which we had to do in the dark. Third room had no shower door and we got bed bugs the last night of our stay. For 180 euro/night, I would not stay there again. Besides when approaching reception personnel, we got no help in any kind of timely manner.
Reviews.Author: fudd42

Reviews.Content: Good location for sight-seeing We were booked by Hotelconnect into the Hotel Ambasciatori but on arrival were informed that we should book into the Hotel Diplomat along the street. Not a good start. They assured us that they were in the same group and that breakfast would be in the Ambasciatori. Breakfast was fine although once you had left your table to go to the buffet, any food/drink was removed from it.Our room was pleasant and kept immaculately clean with fresh towels every day.However, on arrival, the TV didn't work at all and the Safe box was not functioning properly. After making a formal complaint to the lady at Reception (a small desk within a few feet of the front door), someone came to fix the TV (no English channels at this point). By next day we had one English channel which repeated the same stories each day all 5 days of our stay. The safe was mended.The location was good except for there being a bus stop just outside so one had to pick one's way through the waiting throng to get anywhere. Also there were a few 'beggars' around.This is certainly not a 4 star hotel as there were no extra facilities.Basically we paid 拢140 a night for a hotel which was not worth that.
Reviews.Author: almarob

Reviews.Content: Not a 4 star hotel Not worth the price.Noisy street outside.Satelite television out of order, only italian channels.Stop in the shower.Poor breakfast, no fruit or vegetabilies, noisy brekfastroom , impolite servants (very buisy).Internetinformation: 1. tea and coffee at the room -not true.2. all include balconies- not true3. all rooms with bathrom- only shower4. hotelbar-closed5. hotelldesk closed 23-07 not possible to chek out the day before leaving.Gustav Giertz Stockholm Sweden(booked together with congress fee, very expencive)
Reviews.Author: SvenGustavsson

Reviews.Content: great location Great location next to rail station,minutes walk from all the sights of Florence.No problems with booking or staff,in fact the staff booked Uffizi tickets for us so we didnt need to queue.Room was ok with roof terrace, views to the Duomo and good air con. As long as you are aware you are in Italy and dont expect the comfort of your own home and a full English breakfast (as some reviewers do) you will have a good stay.
Reviews.Author: manofgwent

Reviews.Content: Not really a 4 star hotel The Diplomat's reception is plain and uninspiring. It is connected to another hotel, the Ambasciatori , which is about 20 metres away. Hence the long corridors. We had a triple room. It had a mini bar and a TV. The TV's reception was very poor and their engineers never managed to repair it the whole time we were there. Still, it's a minor point as we spent very little time in our room. The bathroom had a walk in shower, no screen, so the floor was wet. The WC was unusually high, so that a short person would find his or her feet off the floor.Breakfast was ok, unless you got there very late. It consisted of various hot drinks, overdone scambled egg, boiled eggs, bread rolls, a toast machine (the conveyor type), yoghurt, ham and salami slices, croissants and cakes, fruit juices and tinned fruit.There are three large rooms to accommodate guests from both hotels for breakfast.Our room was clean and comfortable. On the day before we left, the curtains were removed to be cleaned, so that we were left with the net curtains only. I complained about this but my protestations fell on deaf ears.The Diplomat has pretentions to being a 4 star, but has not quite made it yet.For those of you who want the convenience of transport, it is across the road from the main railway staion and all local and national bus services.
Reviews.Author: Voysey

Reviews.Content: CITY RESIDENCE Arrogance beyond belief!! dont believe the photos/official garb We booked Hotel Diplomat direct online. Official garb promised: Lovely photo, away from traffic, greenery all around. All rooms had balconies, good views over city etc etc. ALL LIES. Hotel Diplomat is only a very small part of a massive complex of interconnecting hotels in the middle of a very busy area next to the railway station. As I was disabled I had planned ahead, reading reviews, contacting hotel to make sure all details were correct especially after reading the bad reviews. Hotel very bad at responding, took me 2 months of repeated emails, phone calls to get detailed conformation of my booking.On arrival told they were fully booked but had a room in their City Residence, just along the very busy main road. Refused the room until I had seen it. Nicely refurbished hotel but offered us a suite with a bed settee, not the twin bedded room ordered. Refused demanded another room, shown a smaller one with twin beds, refused as it was too small. Offered another room at the Hotel Diplomat, escorted back to hotel, walked for miles through corridors eventually shown a sub standard room, refused this so was taken down a shorter way via a lift that took us straight out to the Hotel Ambasciatori. Total disbelief that they could try a deceitful trick like that on a disabled person, or anyone else come to that. Eventually, after an hour arguing agreed to have the second room. Hotel receptionist was arrogant beyond belief, the manager just as bad. Breakfast served in one gigantic room for all hotels, very busy. If you can get this hotel (City Residence) really cheap go there, expect to be lied to and you will love your stay!
Reviews.Author: asthistorian

Reviews.Content: If you value your safety and belongings... DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I always check Tripadvisor before booking any place to stay, and I have never written a review myself. However, my experience at the BH Hotel Diplomat was SO bad and frightening that I felt it my duty to warn other travelers.I recently stayed at the Hotel Diplomat ( July 23rd) and had a horrible experience. #1 - Although we booked at the Diplomat, upon our arrival we were told to go down the street b/c our booking had been changed to an associated hotel, the Hotel Ambasciatori. #2- In the early morning ( between 3AM and sun up) of the 23rd of July, while we were in the room sleeping, a prowler broke into our room , that was on the 5th floor! The thief proceeded to take a chair and our purses out of the room, steal my camera, blackberry and cash, and a few cokes from the minibar to boot!!!! This was obviously a professional as neither I nor my roomate heard anyone in the room ( and we had NOT been drinking). When we notified the front desk that our room had been broken into, the response was  We will not call the police, b/c they will not come and unfortunately we know this, b/c this has happened here before!!!!What type of hotel knows this type of crime happens at their property, yet takes absolutely no safety precautions for it's guests??? A hotel that does not care!!! Although this time it was property, it very well could have been much worst and wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.Whatever you do , DONT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: khadi426

Reviews.Content: One good point: Location. We stayed in this Hotel for three days in July. Hotel is near Termini. You don't have to take a Taxi. Hotel is close to all major attractions. That is probably all good that is about this Hotel.Just before the Entrance to the Hotel there is a Bus stop on a narrow side of the street. Very often you have to wait to get into Hotel.Our room was so tiny, not enough even for one person. My husband  I had to put our luggege from both sides of the bed, there was no other space. I had to remember every time I got up from the bed not to trip!!!TV was not working when we checked in and we were told that they were working on it. The problem was in a whole Hotel. We left three days later and TV still was not working.Breakfast was SO-SO, breakfast room was crowded.If you want to enjoy Florence, look for some other Hotel.
Reviews.Author: Marichka-7

Reviews.Content: Clean, central accommodation The highlight of this hotel was walking out of the train station and virtually stumbling across it. Apart from having to wait past the supposed 2pm check-in time to actually get into our room (and having to leave our bags in the lobby), we had no real problems with this hotel. The 'American Breakfast' did leave a bit to be desired, but the room was reasonably sized and clean. I would agree with other reviewers that it did seem more like a 3 star hotel than 4. Overall, basic accommodation with close proximity to transport and a fair few tourist attractions.
Reviews.Author: NoTentsHere

Reviews.Content: Ronseal Hotel Probably one of the noisiest roads in Florence made our stay in the hotel less than pleasurable. However, the breakfast is great and being right next to the station made finding it very easy.The room stank of cigarettes, and the receptionist told us that they were all the same which was disappointing. Also the air con was broken, and they never came to fix it after we told them numerous times.
Reviews.Author: Clubmurder

Reviews.Content: Robbed!!!!! Whilst staying at the diplomat our room was robbed, resulting in 400 euros being stolen. We reported the theft to the hotel and also to the police. The police told us to get a statement from the hotel so that we could claim for the loss on our insurance. However, when we asked the hotel for a statement they insisted that we leave the matter in their hands and that they would refund us through their own insurance. However...one year on, numerous faxes and phonecalls later we are no further forward and they haven't even acknowledged our complaints! There was also a french hotel guest who was mugged and robbed that same evening and lost everything - literally outside the hotel door.Having stayed in florence on several occasions we now no longer trust the supposedly higher class hotels and feel far more secure in the smaller city hotels where we have experienced nothing like what happened to us in the diplomat!
Reviews.Author: nels1951

Reviews.Content: Do not stay here Do not stay here.We booked through a travel agent and arrived with a confirmation number. They told us we had cancelled, and they had no rooms. They did offer rooms at a sister hotel at 1.5 times the cost. They told us we could not use my credit card and use their phone to call our travel agent.I think bait and switch.We walked across the street to the travel agent in the train station, and one of the options they gave us was this hotel !!! We told her we had just come from there and there were no rooms. The travel agent 200 yards away in Florence said Look, right here on the screen, they say they have rooms. We elected to go elsewhere.You may well arrive and have no place to stay.
Reviews.Author: Traveler123Iowa

Reviews.Content: You can do MUCH better If all you care about is proximity to the train or bus station and having a clean, cheap room with breakfast included then go ahead and stay here. However, the hotel itself is akin to staying in a Motel Six grade lodging. The biggest plus - the room was very clean. Other than that, it was in a noisy area, the furniture was mostly made of particle board, the towels were small and thin and the breakfast had very little that was appealing except a few pastries (the fruit was canned or there were strange luncheon type meats and vienna sausage type items). This hotel sits on a very busy street directly across from the train station and around the corner from the bus stop. My recommendation, unless you are a true budget traveler (student, back-packer etc) or okay with a very generic, motel six kind of lodging spend a little bit more and stay elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: AlaskanGirlinCA

Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 4 star This hotel is graded as a 4*. In my view the service and facilities offered are more on a parr to a 2/3*. The hotel had advertised the fact that there was parking available. However, when we arrived we were told that there was a charge of 27 euros per day. This would have been fine, had they advertised this and not given the impression that there was free parking available. We were also sold a 'superior twin/double with City View and Room upgrade. American Breakfast'. We were told that there were no city view rooms available and when I complained about this, I was told by the receptionist that 'I was making a fuss over nothing!' As for the American Breakfast....you can hardly call it this. The breakfast selection was more like a continental breakfast of the usual staples of cereal and ham and processed cheese. If you do get there 15 minutes before breakfast is closing there is hardly any food left. The breakfast room is also little to be desired. For a start, it is a shared room with the two adjoining the Hotels that the chain own. So you eat breakfast with about 100 other people in a room that has no air conditioning. For a 4* hotel, the room was a good size though the shower only had one shower door, such that the water dripped on to the bathroom floor and we had to mop up the mess with the bathroom towels. Also be careful of the electrics. I plugged my hair dryer into the socket and nearly electrocuted myself when blue sparks came out and the electrics went out. When i reported this to reception, I was told by the chap that it was my fault! If you want to leave your suitcases with the hotel, you can do so in the lobby. For a 4* I would expect the bags to be taken to secure area not be kept in public area. The service is dreadful and I got the impression that they were not into customer service. The final straw was when we asked for our car to be bought back to the hotel by 5pm in order we could make our flight to the airport. We arrived back at the hotel by 5 and the car was nowhere to be seen. What a surprise! I would not stay here again, or at any of their other hotels. The Hotel Davantzi, which I stayed in in December is a million times better and it is only a 3*.
Reviews.Author: mabelflower

Reviews.Content: Great location, overpriced and unhelpful staff We arrived fairly weary after driving from Florence to find the our room was double booked. Through broken English we were advised to travel to another hotel, not ideal through Florence traffic, so argued that having booked so far in advance to benefit from the location and it being a special occasion perhaps they could squeeze us in. Lots of arguing later, we were given a small noisy room, without aircon and in definite need of repair. A lousy and unnecessarily stressful start to the trip. The hotel itself is pleasant, a long liner building that is two hotels merged with the larger rooms being in the Diplomat. Our room was in the other part of the hotel and had a rowdy bunch of Italian school kids on the second and third nights so we got little sleep and there was total carnage in the corridors the next morning. The hotel bar lays on evening snacks, but you more than pay for them given the price of drinks. Breakfast in the morning is a canteen, but otherwise perfectly edible. I would strongly advise against driving, parking in Florence is exceptionally expensive (拢30/day) and navigating is tiring 鈥?plus the central train station is directly outside of the hotel. All up, despite a few positives and being very well seasoned travellers (relatively low basic expectations) this hotel verged on spoiling our weekend trip. I鈥檇 go as far as saying perhaps look at alternatives first.
Reviews.Author: sbis

Reviews.Content: Good choice for honeymoon We stayed there from March 13 to 16, 2007. The hotel building is long because it's two hotels connected, and though it has a little small rooms, theyre O.K., very clean, good bathroom, balcony, and near tourist buses, and Stations (bus sation and the Main Train station). If you have some time, visit Siena in Tuscany, and the Chianti wine region (e.g. Castello D'Albola), you will not be dissapointed! They offer tours for tuscany places, Its more beautiful than Florence itself!!!!, The hotel staff was courteous, and have information about tours. Ask them! They have a breakfast buffet, with hams, salamis, pastries, coffee, juices, breads and toasts, etc.The area was not the safest, so practice common sense security with passports, and cameras, etc.
Reviews.Author: lunadream

Reviews.Content: Great Location! Stayed here in mid Feb together with my husband. We arrived from Pisa hence the location was perfect as it was just across the road from the train station. Was super convenient when we departed for Rome via train. Rooms are very clean, friendly staff at the front desk. Only downside was no internet in rooms but at point of departure we were told that the hotel is in the midst of installing WIFI. Overall excellent value for price and location. Would stay again
Reviews.Author: Pigletz

Reviews.Content: Perfect location! The Diplomat is part of the BH chain of hotels. We found it no problem - directly across the road from the train station.The reception area was quite basic but don't let that put you off as the rooms are modern and clean. Check in was quick and the staff were really helpful. The room was lovely - spotlessly clean and had a large bathroom with complimentary toiletries. Room also has Satellite TV and a minibar. Breakfast was buffet style and consisted of breads, croissants, continental cheeses, ham, pastries, fruit. Something to suit everyone.The hotel could not be in a better position. Ideally located for the historical centre, piazzas and shops (5 mins walk). You also have the train station opposite to explore other areas of Italy. I would recommend the restaurant next door to the hotel called Pastarito - lovely food and excellent value for money.I would definitely return to this hotel. Excellent value and perfect location.
Reviews.Author: Wee_Lady

Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! You can't beat this hotel for it's perfect location next to the main train station - not only was it ideal for catching buses/trains to other parts of Tuscany, but you were no more than 5/10 minute walk from the historical centre. The rooms were clean and tidy with the maid coming in daily. The bathroom was a little on the small side and without a bath, (but that didn't bother us,) and towels were changed daily and complimentary toiletries topped up when we needed them!Previous reviews had mentioned that the breakfast was sparce - well, they must have cranked it up a gear because you were spoilt for choice! Coffee was great, and you could even ask for a cappuccino or expresso at no extra charge, there was always something hot, aswell as the obligatory cold meats and cheeses and the custard croissants were not to be missed! We very rarely even bothered stopping for lunch as we were still full from breakfast!One down side was the noise of the traffic! I would definitely recommend a pair of earplugs! As we went in January we had the windows shut and it was still pretty bad even on the top floor. But it's a small price to pay for being in such a prime location.
Reviews.Author: snogaroonies

Reviews.Content: Hotel Diplomat . . . well . . . It was right across the street from the train station so we were able to avoid the Taxi drivers, but it is about a 5 minute walk to the heart of Florence - not a bad trade-off for it's price versus location. The room was really pretty non-descript. There was a hair dryer, but there was not any kind of shower curtain and only had a hand held shower. It may be due to their renovations, because the web-site shows a small glass partition.If you are American, you will not enjoy their breakfast. They had a buffet dish of little hot dogs, a lot of desserts, but no fresh fruit, no eggs, no bacon, and just knd of weird biscuits. They do have the best little cafe next door where yu can buy fresh bakery goods and get an inexpensive bottle of wine or beer or any kind of snack without paying the mini bar prices. - and the people at the cafe are really sweet. ( One morning when we were kind of in a hurry because we had rented a car to go see Pisa we decided to pick upo breakfast there. I picked up a container of what I thought was peach yogurt, but the cashier handed me a straw. It turned out to be the very best peach juice I ever tasted - I guess I never had peach juice, and I have not yet been able to find it in the U.S.The hotel is average at best, but if you need to save money, it is fine, but you will have some problems with the staff. There is no concierge service, and when we requested more toilet paper, it took 4 hours to get it.It is not the U.S., but you can deal if the price is right.
Reviews.Author: BillieAnn

Reviews.Content: great hotel This place is a great deal. The rooms are average size with REAL air conditioning. Some rooms even have terraces. Right across the street from the train station, which is now a comfortable neighborhood.Breakfast buffet is HUGE and delicious
Reviews.Author: edw11215

Reviews.Content: Close to train station Hotel Diplomat is steps from Stazione Santa Maria Novella. When leaving the station, be sure to take the entrance on the right. Go down the steps and look to the right. Diplomat is across the street on the right. Very convenient for those staying three days or less. Not a far walk to most attractions. The neighborhood is very busy. Lots of traffic and people during the day. No idea what it's like at night because we retired to the hotel by 8 pm each night.The room looks like it was updated in the last five years. Some dings on the walls from suitcases, but a clean room. The bathroom is very modern. Not enough towels, two bath towels for two people and a couple hand towels. Beds are pretty rock hard, but plenty and comfortable pillows. Everything is clean.Breakfast is dull and repetitive. Same old things every day. Rolls/croissants, bland cereal, yogurt, canned fruit, brown hard boiled eggs, tiny hot dog-like sausages, awful coffee.
Reviews.Author: bluesealover

Reviews.Content: Great location but some problems The hotel is in a fantastic location, right next to the Santa Maria Novela train station, within walking distance of all the major attractions. The room was of a good standard, it looked pretty new or newly renovated. We had a balcony as well with nice views of the surrounding Tuscan hills. Breakfast was an excellent buffet with a wide variety of choices and the staff were all quite friendly and helpful.However, it seems that there isn't much sound proofing in the hotel. Our room faced the road side and so each morning, we were rudely woken up by the noise of street cleaners, followed shortly after by traffic. There are outdoor shutters on the windows but that didn't help much even when closed. There also seemed to be a problem with their water supply during busy hours, e.g around 8am. We had to forgo showers one morning due to the complete lack of water, which madeit a bit uncomfortable given the heat of the summer.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: very handy very handy for eveything - bus/train from pisa only 200yds away- room small but adequate and very clean -bedding changed every day. Little road noise to disturb.Breakfast taken in hotel ambasciatori next door - just short walk along connecting corridor - can also use that hotel lounge/bar
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointing The hotel room was fine, if a little small (esp the bathroom) .We discovered that the air conditioning doesn't get switched on until May, so the choice was a stifling hot quiet room or open windows to be able to breathe but not sleep due to the noise outside. The hotel is across from the station and within easy reach of the centre of town, but there are terrible roadworks outside the hotel and the road is so busy. All we heard were sirens and motorbikes all through the night so we got up to face days of sightseeing absolutely exhausted and very grumpy! The breakfast offered was quite basic and we could not get a cup of tea or coffee or a clean table on any of the days we went . Wouldn't stay again or recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: kmcg8a

Reviews.Content: Terrific value Stayed at this hotel in December 2005. Right across from Ryanair bus drop off. Although right next to train  bus station did not see anyone who looked bothersome or dodgy. Had a leaking shower in room which was fixed as soon as we told them. Rooms were very comfortable and serviced every day. Very close to all areas of interest. Given reasonable price paid cannot complain about anything within this hotel. Lots of hotels in Florence have poor plumbing and lots of stairs due to age of buildings which is to be expected but no such problems within this hotel as it had been recently renovated. Used to staying in real budget accommodation but this was above average for price.
Reviews.Author: Suge

Reviews.Content: Dodgey location Across the road from the side entrance to the railway station, loads of shadey looking characters on the way back into town. Room was big and clean, but a shower with no shower curtain never fails to annoy me. The staff were unfriendly to the point of being ignorant. Overall I would not stay here again, pick a hotel in santa maria novella if you want somewhere around this location..
